name: sprite begins
content:
Sprite begins doing a specified behavior.

(Opens YouTube in new tab)

[How To Make A Sprite](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbTJpx3driA)

The sprite will begin running a behavior over and over again. The sprite will repeatedly run the set of actions contained in the behavior while the project is being run, unless it is instructed to stop. For more information see [`Adding and Removing Behaviors`(#89eba4)](/docs/spritelab/spritelab_adding-and-removing-behaviors/).

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: The fish will begin continuously swimming left and right when the project is run.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: When the phone is clicked, it will begin jittering.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group beginning the behavior

short_description: Sprite begins doing a specified behavior.
